intro: Cleistanthus morii, commonly known as the Malabar cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green flowers with red bracts. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in evergreen forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
